page.title: 01KINGSKERSWELL/ABBOTSKERSWELL
page.content: {Our area has 3 main villages, {Kingskerswell,Abbotskerswell and {Ipplepen.There are many dairy,sheep {and cereal crop farms in this area and {one productive quarry.There are a lot {of hills and small fields .The fields {are mostly for rough grazing and the {average size is 4.924 acres. {The largest wood is called Kerswell {Downs.There are two railway lines {running through the area, the Newton {Abbot to Paignton and the main Great {Western Railway, from Newton Abbot to {Plymouth.There are four churches, {three of them have towers.The two {oldest are in Abbotskerswell and in {Kingskerswell.In this area there are {lots of lanes which used to be major {routes and a lot of pubs.One of the {pubs used to be an old mill which was {called, and still is Bickley Mill. { }
